00001 /**************************************************************************
00002 $Header: GENINDEX.C Fri 10-27-2000 9:37:26 pm HvA V2.01 $
00003 
00004 HIST: 20001027 V2.01 - Adapted for DJGPP
00005 ***************************************************************************/

00007 /************************************************************************
00008 *                                                                       *
00009 *  GENINDEX - Create index from text file.                              *
00010 *                                                                       *
00011 *  Support Program for The Window BOSS                                  *
00012 *                                                                       *
00013 *  Copyright (c) 1984,1985,1986 - Philip A. Mongelluzzo                 *
00014 *  All rights reserved.                                                 *
00015 *                                                                       *
00016 *  Note: The GENINDEX.EXE file was created using the CI86 compiler.     *
00017 *        If you attempt to recompile this program with either Lattice   *
00018 *        or MSC you may have to adjust the logic to account for the way *
00019 *        the various compilers treat <CR><LF> sequences.  This usually  *
00020 *        amounts to nothing more than chaning the "rb" to "r" in the    *
00021 *        fopen statement.                                               *
00022 *                                                                       *
00023 *  History:                                                             *
00024 *                                                                       *
00025 *  911126 V0.2 - Generized subject heading key to the                   *
00026 *                sequence "#%" so this can be anywhere on               *
00027 *                a line                                                 *
00028 *  911127 V0.3 - Adjusted special characters to make a text-            *
00029 *                file which also can be used by 'HELPPC' (V2.10)        *
00030 *                                                                       *
00031 ************************************************************************/
00032 
00033 /*------------------------------------------------------------------------
00034   HelpPC text files are simple ASCII files that contain control codes
00035   in column one.   Each file must contain a menu title in the first
00036   line.  The remainder of the file consists of keyed lines and help
00037   text.  Each line must end with a CR/LF pair (standard DOS format) and
00038   shouldn't be longer than 79 characters.   Tabs position the text at
00039   8 character tab positions.  The following is a list of keys and
00040   special characters (keys are found in column 1, special characters
00041   appear in columns 1-80):
00042 
00043    '@'  in column 1 indicates a file title which will appear in
00044         the main topic menu.  This must be the very first line
00045         in the file and has a maximum length of 40 characters
00046         (excluding the '@').
00047    ':'  in column 1 indicates a subtopic key.  Multiple keys separated
00048         by colons ':' can be entered on the same line.  Single spaces
00049         are allowed in a key, multiple spaces are compressed to single.
00050    '%'  in column 1 indicates a highlighted title line.
00051    '^'  in column 1 indicates a centered highlighted title.
00052    ' '  (space) in column 1 indicates normal text.
00053    '~'  Tilde is used to mark text as a subtopic link.  Use two
00054         tilde characters to represent an actual tilde in the data.
00055         A word or phrase enclosed between tilde's will become a
00056         subtopic link for the current topic.
00057    TAB  in column 1 starts text in column 9
00058    any other character in column 1 is truncated
00059 
00060    Limits of the genindex() and help()
00061 
00062    Max items in main topic menu:          16
00063    Max items in subtopic menu:           512
00064    Max topics in index:                 1800
00065    Max size of topic text:             16384 bytes
00066    Max lines of text per topic:          512
00067    Max topic key length:                  20
00068    Max file title length:                 40
00069    Max subtopic links:                   120
00070    No limit on text file size
00071 
00072 -----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00073 
00074 #include <stdio.h>                      /* Standard stuff */
00075 #include <stdlib.h>
00076 #include <string.h>
00077 #include <ctype.h>
00078 
00079 #ifndef FALSE
00080 #define FALSE 0
00081 #define TRUE !FALSE
00082 #endif
00083 
00084 /*#+func-------------------------------------------------------------------
00085    FUNCTION: trimstr(char *s)
00086     PURPOSE: Trim leading and trailing blanks of a string
00087  DESRIPTION: -
00088     RETURNS: TRUE if all OK, FALSE if it 's' is a NULL pointer
00089     VERSION: 901101 V0.1
00090 --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00091 int trimstr(char *s)
00092 {
00093   int i;
00094 
00095   if (s == NULL)
00096     return(FALSE);
00097 
00098   i = strlen(s);
00099   if (i==0)
00100     return(TRUE);
00101 
00102   while (isspace(s[--i]))       /* Delete trailing blanks */
00103     s[i] = '\0';
00104 
00105   i = 0;                      /* Delete leading blanks */
00106   while (isspace(s[i]))
00107     i++;
00108   strcpy(s,s+i);
00109 
00110   return(TRUE);
00111 }
00112 
00113 /*#+func-------------------------------------------------------------------
00114    FUNCTION: main()
00115     PURPOSE: main function of 'GENINDEX.C'
00116  DESRIPTION: -
00117     RETURNS: Alway's returns 0
00118     VERSION: 901101 V0.1
00119              920205 V0.1 - Added trimstr() to trim topic key
00120 --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00121 int main(int argc,char *argv[])
00122 {
00123   FILE *fp;
00124   FILE *fo;
00125   char buf[132];
00126   static char fname[132];
00127   unsigned i;
00128   long pos;
00129   char *p;
00130   char *token;
00131 
00132   if(argc < 2)       /* check command line */
00133   {
00134     printf("Usage: genindex <filename.ext>");
00135     exit(1);
00136   }
00137 
00138   p = argv[1];      /* parse input filename */
00139   i = 0;
00140   while(*p) {
00141     fname[i++] = *p++;
00142     if(*p == ' ' || *p == '.') break;
00143   }
00144   strcat(fname, ".ndx");                /* create output filename */
00145 
00146   fp = fopen(argv[1], "r");             /* open input */
00147   if(!fp) {
00148     printf("Open failed: %s", argv[1]);
00149     exit(1);
00150   }
00151   printf("Creating: %s\n", fname);        /* say whats going on */
00152   fo = fopen(fname, "w");                 /* open output */
00153 
00154   while(fgets(&buf[0],132,fp))            /* read lines till eof */
00155   {
00156     /*-------------------------------------------
00157       Check if this line starts with a topic key
00158     ---------------------------------------------*/
00159     if(buf[0] == ':')                     /* look for topic key  */
00160     {
00161       token = strtok(buf,":\n\r");
00162       trimstr(token);
00163       while (token)
00164       {
00165         pos = ftell(fp);                        /* get file position */
00166         fprintf(fo,"%s\n%ld\n",token,pos);      /* write to index file */
00167         fprintf(stdout,"%s\n%ld\n",token,pos);  /* display on console */
00168         token = strtok(NULL,":\n\r");           /* Look for next subtopic key */
00169       }
00170     }
00171 
00172   }
00173   fclose(fp);                             /* close files */
00174   fclose(fo);
00175   return(0);
00176 }
